Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Silje_NO
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, and the best thing about the hotel. The staff is also very friendly. Our room was small, and could need some renovation, but for that price our expectations were low so we did't mind. Would certainly consider staying here next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within comfortable walking distance from the station and has a canal-side central location. Although the room had a canal-view, that did not make up for a small room with too much furniture. No double glazing and thin walls made it rather noisy and the bed was not very comfortable. We asked for a sink plug on the first day, but none materialised and the fan in the ensuite didn't work so everything got wet and steamy when having a shower. Breakfast was very disappointing, and would have been 10 euros per person extra after the first morning - certainly not worth it when excellent breakfasts were available from restaurants in the locality. This hotel could be great (after all, it has a great location) but it looks and feels very tired and is definitely in need of some modernisation - when we visit Amsterdam again we will be looking for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located. It is close to everything. The staff are friendly and full of advise. Rooms are small but we learnt from a tour guide this is normal in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ceedie
Reviews.Content: When we initially arrived we thought the hotel was closed as the door was locked and inside the building was dark. On the front door it stated it was the Hotel Amsterdam, but we soon found out the actual hotel was a little further down the walk. The door we tried to open turned out to be an old office/storeroom area. I suggested they put an arrow on this door to show where the actual hotel was so tourists like us and others we saw didn't get confused. When we arrived the hotel was putting in a new boiler and they told us it would be a couple hours before we had hot water. But unfortunately, that was not true and we were not able to take a hot shower until the following day. Initially our room was to be on the 2nd floor overlooking the canal but when my husband opened the door it was already occupied! We were given another room on the 3rd floor which was clean and everything decorated in RED. (We were compensated for our room mix-up by getting the 2nd day's breakfast for free.) The room was large enough with wood flooring, a king size bed and another single bed, a wardrober, free internet, a TV, desk, chair, 2 nightstands one on each side of the bed, and 2 big windows that overlooked the canal. The bathroom was long and narrow but clean. The shower was great once we had hot water. There is an elevator (lift) which was somewhat scary to go into (at least for me) as it was old and small, and I was afraid of getting stuck in it (we never did). So I took the narrow, curvy staircase up to our room instead. This hotel is rather old and could use a face lift and updated furnishings but it had a somewhat homey feel to it. Breakfast was free your first day and after that it cost 10 euros. After our 2 days free we went elsewhere to eat as we didn't feel it was worth the money. It was mainly a continental style breakfast with pastries and cereals but you could make your own eggs if you wanted to. with fresh coffee and assorted teas. The staff manning the desk were very nice, friendly and very accommodating. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance to the city center. On our last night we asked the staff to get us a taxi for our early departure and one was waiting for us. We could not have been happier. So overall it was a nice stay with a few quirks but in a good location. We definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel, perfectly located on the Amstel in a very scenic corner of Amsterdam city centre. We turned up on the doorstep to book our room, having left our previous (and supposedly more up-market) hotel after a disappointing experience, and we were able to take the last remaining room for the rest of our stay. As the name suggests, the hotel is very homely, and stylish in a casual, informal sort of way. The room was small but full of character and had a lovely view of the canal. The decoration is a little worn-out in places, and the shower-room floor was not very clean (take your flip-flops) - otherwise I would give this hotel five stars. The breakfast is excellent and very comprehensive - it was free on the first day and 10 euros after that. You can even cook your own eggs to just the way you like them! The staff are very friendly and helpful and genuinely ensure you have a good stay. There was a little noise from the street at night, but given that this is on the route between the Rembrandtplein and the red light district then I guess this is just to be expected on a Saturday night. My only concern is that a little maintenance will be needed to stop the decor deteriorating over time, and my only regret is that we couldn't stay there longer. I have stayed in many business hotels in Amsterdam but this little place is much nicer and an antidote to the corporate glitz of the big hotel chains. We definitely would like to stay here again and I shall be recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat overrated”
Reviews.Author: the42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a few days of holiday. The location is very central but situated off the main thoroughfare just enough not to have too much street and canal noise. This is fortunate because the windows are single-glazed and don't shut very well. You will however hear the doors of other rooms slamming because the doors seem to stick. It's like busting into your own room, which may be slightly amusing. The view of the canal from the upper floor we stayed in was rather picturesque. The room however could use some redecoration/maintenance and a really good cleaning, particularly the bathroom, which in our room was a narrow little wet room. (Who thought a tiled swamp was a good idea?) It was gross enough that we both bought pairs of novelty flip flops so we never had to put our bare feet on the carpet or the dingy tile floor. Now I know why the hotel's website has so few photos and sparse information. Thank goodness for review sites, eh? The hotel staff gave us the first breakfast free but it's â‚¬10 each after that. After trying it we decided against what is a basic continental breakfast for the next day. They have eggs on offer but you have to cook them yourself which feels strange, especially when paired with the classical music being played as if it's a hoity-toity place. It was like a Dutch Fawlty Towers. In spite of a few oddities and the uncleanliness it was not a bad stay. The staff are polite and the price is pretty reasonable. It's Amsterdam, it's supposed to be an adventure.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Savor Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes45
Reviews.Content: The supplies we brought from home for our trip are just about done. It's time to pack up, go home and hug family that has been greatly missed. But not before savoring Amsterdam...home of stroopwafles, aged Gouda cheese and the summer sale of Kalverstraat. And the best place to do it is from Amsterdam House Hotel. It is a small, quiet hotel by a lovely canal. Centrally located but without the usual hustle and din one expects from a central location. The owners are very helpful, friendly and gracious. There are a few tables set outside where guests can serenely watch the world and fellow tourists go by while sipping espressos. Breakfast on the first morning is free. But because their breakfasts are substantial, one does not mind paying for them on subsequent days. Moreover, one can choose to take breakfast up to 12 noon. Kalverstraat is just a 5-7 minute walk, so is Waterlooplein, on the opposite direction, the tram stations are 'a hop and a skip' away. There are cobbled alleys to explore and out-of-the-way restaurants and pretty shops to pleasantly discover in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with character and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: brownbag_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with a group of friends last weekend and couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel. It's location is great very easily accessible by tram fron central station and within walking distance of all the sights and nightlife. Clean room overlooking the canal but still nice and quiet at night, no street noise. If I return to amsterdam I will absolutely return to this hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and served delicious coffee's every morning.

Reviews.Title: “burn the place down”
Reviews.Author: eattoomuch1
Reviews.Content: We rented a houseboat from them. Very dirty. No heat. No TV. No towels, No light in bathroom. Told it was non smoking, you could not get rid of the smoke odor with the windows open. No instructons or info provided for area or how the boat works. We wrote list and gave to front desk. Basically no response. We were given one light bulb and 3 towels. TV never did work. Heater was turned on after 2 nd day. Was told at check out, owner is elderly and does want to spend any money on fixing anythin up. NEVER< NEVER stay here. RHT. Palm Springs California

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fox036
Reviews.Content: Lovely place. We took the tram to get there the first day and then walked everywhere. No matter where we wanted to go it was not more than 20 minutes away. The location is great and the views of the canal are great if you are on floors 2,3 or 4. The staff is outstanding. Very warm and helpful. The hotel is charming. The rooms are what we expected for 3 stars.It could be updated a bit but we were happy. The bed was really comfortable. If we did not get a good night sleep somtimes it's beacuse life on the canal is noisy. The rooms vere cleaned but ours was not vaccummed well each day. Oh, very inportant, there is an elevator! great after a long 20 hours of travel to get there. The hotel photo is very accurate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: christineandrob Posted by a Viaggiare traveler
Reviews.Content: on arrival we was warmly welcomed by Will, who upgraded us to a lovely room overlooking Amstel canal,.,the room was clean tidy,with tea/coffee making facilities. the sheets and towels were clean and changed daily, the staff were friendly and made us feel very welcome,.,even offering breakfast at 1pm as were late risers,.the area in which the hotel was situated was quiet but everything we needed was only a short walk away. we had a perfect couple of days and thanks to Will and staff for making our first experience of Amsterdam one to remember,.,. we will be back in August,..,

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly and a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Jan1956
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8pm Thursday evening, cross and wet from the rain after stupidly looking for the hotel in the wrong street. We usually stay in the Eden, Rembrandt Square and I'd misjudged the map reference for the Eureka and it's actually nearer the square than I'd thought. Somehow I'd also mislaid the street name, so it was difficult to locate, but other hotels were keen to advise us and sent us in the right direction with our hotel marked out on a map! Anyhow, 'Eureka. we found it' at last and were given a lovely warm welcome by Will, who is typically Dutch - naturally friendly and helpful. Like others here have said, we were given vouchers for a free breakfast the next morning, then signed in, had a chat with Will and then got the funny little lift to our room, number 45 on the top floor. I had read the reviews on TA and was a bit apprehensive after reading how small some of the rooms were. I aleady knew we didn't have a canalside view, because we'd booked with Expedia and it cost more to have a front view, which we never went for due to the added cost. My partner was immediately disappointed at the tiny size of the room and spent much of the weekend wishing we'd gone to the Eden again. But I enjoyed it and he had to agree it was a great location at least. The room was quite small, just enough room to walk each side of the bed and a bit more space at the foot of it to enter the shower/toilet room. But it was very warm and homely, freshly painted in white with warm red furnishings and had everything necessary. The bed was clean and comfortable, there was a TV, DVD player (with free use of internet, DVDs and books from downstairs), and more importantly for me - a radio! The washroom had a toilet, basin, new looking shower space (like a small walk-in wet room, but no bath in room 45) and had a hair dryer, shower gel, soap, lots of fresh white towels and mirrors. The bedroom had a small corner table, tea and coffee making facilities, a safe, small wardrobe, extra blanket, phone, chair, window blinds and curtains, wall lamps, radiator (we were cosily warm all night) and clean pillows. A few downsides. One was that all the room doors made loud shutting noises, unavoidably, so without meaning to, noises were made whenever anyone came up to their rooms. And in the middle of the night, for some reason the radiator (whether on or off) made weird 'clunking' noises which were annoying but stopped eventually. And I noticed that at least one of the lampshades hanging directly over the dining room table we used, was quite dusty - not good where there is food. The location is fantastic, any direction you walk from outside the hotel, is worth exploring. Waterlooplein and the flea market, Rembrandt Square, Kalverstraat for shopping, the Amstel and so much more - all within a couple of minutes walk! Our breakfast was lovely and relaxing - the dining room is a quaint mixture of homeliness and olde worlde, with a very laid back and charming atmosphere. A box of Scrabble on the table and a huge bookcase sets the scene for a really relaxing visit. And a sliding door from the dining room opens out onto the terrace outside, where you can sit on nice days, enjoying the canalside view with your drink. All things considered, I enjoyed staying here and the most important things (for me) were all here - a comfortable bed, mainly clean all over, private shower, peaceful atmosphere, friendly staff and a great location. Unless you are the type to spend huge amounts of time in your room, this will suit most people. A few of my personal secrets and favourites! - 1) Smokey coffee shop in Rembrandt Square is the friendliest one and has a great atmosphere, Fri/Sat nights you can meet some great people - all you need to do is just get chatting and you've made a new friend. 2) La Place in Kalverstraat is absolutely brilliant for great food at any time of day - coffee, fresh juice and cheese and ham croissants for breakfast and for lunch try their home made soups, then in the evening some fresh salad and grilled chicken or fish with potato wedges - they really do serve lovely food and it's a great place to sit and they even have a roof terrace. 3) Get your sandwiches, slices of delicious 'old' Gouda cheese, juice drinks and fruit snacks all relatively cheaply from Hema and take them to eat in Rembrandt Square or on one of the canal benches watching the world go by. 4) Cafe Tante Roosje on Rembrandtplein is the best place to watch the night go by - try their wonderful huge banana and chocolate pancakes, while you sit under the outside heating with a blanket for covering your legs! 5) Enjoy a slice of chocolate cake and an iced tea outside the Majestic in Dam Square, while Steve the bluesman serenades you with some old 60s classics. 6) Don't leave Amsterdam without trying the freshly cooked fries from Manneken Pis on Damrak, on your way to Centraal Station. This was my 7th visit in 2 years - yes, I love Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “good all round”
Reviews.Author: revpetermcdowell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the location great-easy to walk to everywhere and find your way round.Hotel owners very friendly and helpful and we got vouchers for a free breakfast on day 1 which was a nice surprise--uaually 10 euro.I had asked for a room with a canal view and a bath and we were given a very small attic room-no. 44 and the head of the bed was 2 feet from the wall to allow you to open the bathroom door!!--should have been a single,however the owner did change us to a lovely room with 2 windows overlooking the canal,low but comfortable bed and warm.The hotel is quite soundproofed which is great and has a lift.I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LauritaUk
Reviews.Content: My family booked me a weekend away for my birthday and this was a lovely place to stay; great central location - able to walk everywhere, relatively quiet area, nice breakfast (i loved that you could make your own omlettes on the hot plate, and the cute heron that begged for cheese outside the window!) and last but not least the wonderful, friendly and helpful staff. No complaints at all - only that we couldn't have stayed longer! Thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asiasstatic
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay through Christmas and New Years. Very Friendly Staff, very friendly and accommodating. Great Location and price with no thrills.. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay and Experience”
Reviews.Author: bmoregirl
Reviews.Content: This is definately an experience to have while staying in Amsterdam. We stayed in a houseboat across from the actual hotel building. Check in was easy and given great area directions. It has shops, supermarkets, restaurants, and tram stations nearby. There was a Christmas market right down the street too. There are bars nearby and on the houseboat we could hear people leaving the bars and clubs. The street noise and canal traffic can be loud as well. The boathouse was big enough for four adults and baby. It has drafts in the bedroom, which in December was bitter cold but in the summer I am sure would be bearable. Would definately not stay again, but would recommend for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “2 bedroom Apt - I want to give it a better review”
Reviews.Author: alsilver1
Reviews.Content: The apt was located at #7, a few doors down from the hotel which is at #3 or #4. The apt is rented out by a less than helpful, completely disorganized person who does just apts and houseboats. Make sure you get an email confirm from them giving you the rate and the building number. The hotel, which is somehow affiliated (got extra towels, crib, etc), had a fantastic staff. Apt #2 at building #7 has two small, shabby bedrooms and a HUGE living room with an amazing view. They made a very valid attempt to clean it but it is pretty run down. Also the apt is two flights up some very steep stairs (no elevator). No help with bags. With that all said, I would stay here again. Fantastic location, large apt with a real kitchen, and a great view of the canal. Great for a family. Good, free wireless internet. We paid 235 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and welcoming hotel in an ideal position overlooking Amstel”
Reviews.Author: CalellaDePalafrugell
Reviews.Content: We have never had such a friendly welcome as when we arrived at this hotel - and it wasn't a "one-off" as the two men and one lady made us feel at home during the three days that we stayed. In line with other reviews, the hotel needs some redecoration and upgrading, but there were so many positives that we will certainly return. They don't serve evening meals, but there are so many restaurants nearby that this wasn't a problem; and it was nice returning to the hotel for a glass or two of wine before going to bed, with gentle jazz or Classic FM playing quiently in the background. Breakfast was excellent, and again Classic FM was playing in the background. Interestingly a heron arrived each morning for its breakfast of cheese! The hotel is ideally situated, overlooking the Amstel and on a quiet road with hardly any traffic; and near to boat trips and the flower market.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quaint hotel comfortable but shabby”
Reviews.Author: quinkie18
Reviews.Content: Good location, great view across Amstel. Easy access to tram and metro. Hotel could do with some refurbishment but it is a fun place to stay. Loads of bars and restaurants nearby plus flower market and large flea/general market nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been so nice...”
Reviews.Author: opydog
Reviews.Content: When my two children (21 and 17) and I decided to go to Amsterdam we began by looking at apartments to rent for a week. Then it occured to us that we might be able to rent one of those lovley houseboats, lining the canals, that you see in the pictures,After a bit of research we settled on Amsterdam House which offered houseboats and pictures. They also had one for the whole week. So even though it was pricey (350.00 $), we booked. The pictures looked lovely and the kids were excited. Unfortunately, after flying for 7 hours, arriving at 7:00 am, finding our way to the hotel where you pick up the keys to the houseboat, the houseboat not being "cleaned" yet...when we finally got there it was ...well let me put it this way... NOT WORTH $350.00 a night. The curtians were stained, the windows had tons of dead bugs all over them, the wallpaper was icky, It didn't look like the pictures at all. They had to be called for clean towels. I asked them to clean the boat one day and all they did was bring clean towels, no cleaning. There are so many beautiful houseboats on the canals, with just a little imagination, and a few pots of flowers on the outside deck of the boat, this place could be a winner, not a looser.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly service but hotel upkeep could stand some slight improvement.”
Reviews.Author: rohit2561
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with excellent view of a canal for most of the rooms. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is quite good also. On the down side (but less important than the up side) the hotel could do with some upkeep. Also, the rooms are small. Perhaps there could be some rooms with just one single bed for solo travellers since the size of a small room becomes even smaller when a huge bed (unnecessary for business travellers) is taking up 70% of the floor space.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for a tiny room”
Reviews.Author: MiaMew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, we paid 315 euros, our own fault we booked on last minute so couldn't find cheaper price, it was also public holiday in holland. We got the canal view room, tiny room, & tired looking. The service was great, very friendly and helpful staff, first night breakfast was free and so delicious wide selection of food. Location is good, near the flowemarket and in the quiet street. If the rooms were better, I'd love to stay in this hotel again due to the great services and location, but to me rooms are very important and for the price you pay it's not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return, to this well located, civilised and helpful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asher_rospigliosi
Reviews.Content: A vast window out from the comfortable big bed, looking over the Amstel. Good breakfast (though it only came with one nights accomodation, which suprised me). The staff are helpful. Even the cleaner remembered to leave extra tea when I asked! Happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: taki143
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here, based on the recommendation of her parents who had stayed there over 2 years prior (who knew it as the Hotel Eureka). We did not use an agency, we booked directly with them on the day of our arrival. (amsterdamhouse.c o m just call them on skype, its just better) All they had available was a double room at the back of the hotel and it cost us 120 Euro for the night (including the incredible breakfast, which is free for the first day you stay there) The room was a little small but was very cute and cosy. The bathroom was clean but also quite small. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the guy who worked in the morning serving the breakfast, he seemed eager to make a good impression. (and he did) The location is great overlooking the Amstel and its nice and quite outside at night but still very close to all the action of Amsterdam. Its also important to note that its one of the few boutique hotels that has an elevator, which really is necessary due to the incredibly narrow stairwells in Amsterdam. I would definitely stay here again but I'd book a little more in advance in order to secure a canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the standard of accomodation”
Reviews.Author: TNADZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, the staff are VERY helpful and polite. The hotel itself is a bit shabby, the corridors and rooms smell of smoke which in this day and age really is a surprise!! We had a canal view room which was nice, Room 34. The room had a nice size bed and the bedding was clean and it was comfortable. The decor of the room could do with attention, the window sills and frames need a coat of paint, the bed side lights and ceiling light need updating. There is a flat screen tv though and they have dvds you can watch from their collection. The bathroom needs tidying up and the walls need demoulding. The whole room could do with a bit of TLC. We paid Â£196.66 for the 2 nights so to be honest this was expensive for the standard of the room. They do give you a free breakfast the 1st morning then after that 10 Euros each. Its a substantial breakfast, with cereals, breads, hams, cheese, make your own omlettes or eggs, juice, coffee. The staff are really very helpful and its just a shame the room wasn't a bit nicer because it could be a quaint little place if they stopped the smokers and tidied up the decor. They have free internet access via their lounge computer too. If location is what you want then this is the place, if luxury is important then this is not. We did despite the decor, have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel with romantic canalview”
Reviews.Author: SusyK2
Reviews.Content: John and I stayed in Eureka Hotel 2 nights the second week of august, ending our stay in Amsterdam. We found friendly and warm welcoming, a nice red room with canal view, the bathroom was small and old, but the breakfast very good and free for the 1st night. Very central, two steps from Rembrandtplein. If you are looking for a small, friendly and cheap B&B in the center of A'dam , you can really feel comfortable here! They also have boat houses and apartments for rent, but we discovered that only checking out, what a shame! I guess we'll go back with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been to - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: TerriJane
Reviews.Content: On Saturday, my friend and I decided at the last minute to spend the night in Amsterdam. We booked a twin bedded room in this hotel on expedia, paying online. It was not the cheapest option but seemed well-located and the reviews seemed generally good. On arrival, we went to check-in, showing our printed online confirmation. At this point, we were told that we would have to pay an additional 15 Euros, because we had apparently booked our twin bedded room for one person. We showed the disinterested woman at reception our expedia booking, which clearly stated that we had booked one double/twin-bedded room and that the base rate we had paid was for two people. The receptionist at first wouldn't even look at our booking confirmation. She then finally did, and agreed to check us in without making the payment requested whilst she spoke to her manager. She told us that we would be pleased with our room, as it had been recently refurbished and was one of the best they had, which we were pleased to hear, obviously. We were startled therefore when we got to our room. It was tiny, filthy and smoke-filled and, most importantly, did not have twin beds. We were aware that due to the late booking we may have only been able to have access to a double room, but felt it unacceptable that she had not mentioned this at reception. We phoned down to complain and were told that we had booked late and this was all we could expect. I expressed strong displeasure and the woman was again disinterested. An hour or so later, we received a call from the receptionist who said she had spoken to the manager and had been told we would have to pay the extra 15 Euros for the room. We asked her on what grounds, and suggested she or her manager looked on the expedia website in order to illustrate that we had paid the correct amount. She said that they did not want to do that, and very rudely told us that we would have to come down immediately to make the extra payment (which we refused to do, making the payment as we left the hotel later that evening). She told us we could "take it up with expedia" if we had a problem. Overall, the experience at this hotel was utterly disgusting and we were both shocked by it. As the manager was apparently also involved at times during this disastrous stay, I can't imagine it was a one-off and would strongly discourage people from staying here in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff,Superb Location.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisdotcom
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam, having pre-booked this hotel via easy to book, staff were great and very helpful through out our stay, (2 Nights), view from room was great across canal. The ensuite room was slightly smaller than I Expected, That may be cos the bed was bigger than expected, we slept very well as beds and room was overall very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent in choice and quantity. But As other reviewers have stated the room decor and Furnishings were a bit quwerky however that adds to the charm , But also agree that the rooms could with a bit of a revamp with regard to Carpets and tiling, as the current style seems to encourage a tatty appearance in places,

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and serive (and breakfast!)”
Reviews.Author: Adanim
Reviews.Content: Here you get exactly what you pay for. Location, location, location, plus and an excellent helpful staff with a great breakfast (and free WiFi and printing). Rooms are adequate - don't expect the Hilton (the carpet is a bit dodgy). Being on gthe cheap side, don't be surprised that the people in the room next to you are more interested in coffee houses than van Gogh (and the smoke from the room proves it...). Check out the great vintage guitar shop next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: System-G
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, we were a little concerned, but we found we needn't have been. We decided to book despite the reviews as we were only using it to rest our heads at night. We booked for two nights. Pretty much everything was good. Very friendly & helpfull staff. We were offered 1 complementary breakfast, but decided to go for breakfast elsewhere recommended by friends on the second morning. Breakfast pricing of 10Euro is definately worth it - especially considering the prices at places that served breakfasts nearby. Good canal views with a good sized double bed. Also allow pets (but confirm at time of booking). We would definately stay here again! Excellent value for money if on a budget. The only downsides was the decor in the rooms is a bit dated now and it could do with a fresh lick of paint, but other than that, it was excellent. It didn't put us off our stay in the slightest though. Also it was a bit hot the first night and we opted to leave the windows open for cool air. Being a Saturday, the noise from crowds accross the canal seemed to never stop, but again, it didn't worry us as we just took it as part of the experience of Amsterdam :) The second night we closed the window and most of the noise was drowned out. We slept very well. The location was great. Close to coffee shops, flea markets, public transport and museums etc... There is no parking at the hotel and parking is expensive in the city, so we parked at the Olympic Stadium and used the Park & Ride facility for 6Euro a day which includes free tram transfer to the centre. Well worth it. Will definately stay there again when we revisit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location...terrible room!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1204
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would never recommend this hotel. I am astonished by the positive reviews that it receives. On the positive side, it is located in a nice enough area. The staff was generally pleasant and helpful when asking for directions and recommendations. There's free breakfast on your first morning and the lobby/sitting area was charming in it's own way. Now to the negative... the rooms were absolutely awful. I can't stress this enough. They are tiny, dark and depressing. My room was so small that the door would not fully open because it was blocked by the bed! All of the furnishings are ancient. The bed was uncomfortable, as the mattress seemed to be wrapped in plastic and rustle every time i moved. And the sheets actually had stains and cigarette burns in them. The carpet was musty and worn with some dark brown stains --- I don't even want to imagine what that was from. And the bathroom was moldy. On top of all of this, the floor was actually slanted. My husband said it literally made him feel off and dizzy. The hallway also smelled of cigarette smoke. This was a very unpleasant, uncomfortable stay. I attempted to switch rooms/floors in hope that I just happened to get a bad room, but the other room they offered was just as dreary and disgusting. After a few days, I couldn't take it anymore and left to check into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HitTheRoadJack44
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to us and we were glad she did. Having read some of the Trip Advisor reviews our expectaions were not overly high. We were pleasantly surprised. It suited our budget and the location was fantastic. It was also nice and quiet. We could walk everywhere, including too and from the train station with our luggage. The buffet breakfast selection was also good. Yes, the hotel is a little quirky and the rooms are not perfect. I certainly recommend getting a canal view room. We were not there to spend masses of time in our room, we were there to see Amsterdam, which is a great walking city, even in the rain! The elevator might have been slow, but at least there was one which is a real bonus. The free internet was also handy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to stay in local smaller establishments and can live without the amenities that come with a luxury hotel. We would definitely stay there again if we were ever to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location and friendly staff vs. cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: tougo
Reviews.Content: We ended our tour of Europe at this hotel. We found it very close to the tram stop and were very pleased with the central location. We were greated by Will who is extremely friendly as is the lady that runs the desk during the day. Our room was a canal view and while the view was nice we were on the top floor which made our room feel smaller with low beams you had to duck under to move from the window to the door. It was not what was pictured on thier website. The bathroom was kinda scary and the shower had a slow drain and the entire bathroom floor was a puddle of water when showering. It was not the cleanest room we had encountered, but the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. The free breakfast the first morning was very nice. Lots of meat and cheese choices, some sweet breads/cakes, and great coffee. The free internet access was a nice plus. I'm not sure if we'd stay here again due to the lack of cleanliness. I understand that it's an old building, but they need to do some upgrading to the carpet and tile.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Ludwik
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an apartment where furniture is old and in bad shape, where the word â€œcleanâ€� is unknown and you pay a lot, then the Amsterdam House apartments are the right choice. When we booked via internet, one third of the total amount was immediately charged on our Visa card and when we arrived there, they made us pay the rest before we had even received the keys. Then during the two weeks of our stay, I had to go every day to the reception to ask for my receipt! The receptionist found every single day an excuse not to give me any piece of paper saying that I had paid! When we first saw the â€œapartmentâ€�, we were extremely disappointed: it had nothing in common with the pictures we saw on their webpage. The description said â€œfully equipped kitchenâ€�: what a sad joke! We did not even have real pans to cook in. The bathroom smelled so bad that I vomited three times during our stay. The beds were very uncomfortable and the TV set did not work properly. But perhaps the worst thing was that the whole apartment was so awfully dirty. We tried to clean it desperately as soon as we arrived. So we really felt that we were cheated!

Reviews.Title: “wish I lived here!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_anyway
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by the website easytobook, which I would recommend as being legitimate and trustworthy. Let me first say that I LOVED this hotel, everything about it. I was checked in by Will, a wonderful, friendly, kind man, who was very helpful and kind throughout my 2 day stay. The free, delicious breakfast the first morning was an added bonus, and I ate there again the morning after (good value for 10â‚¬). The rooms were comfortable, with DVDs to borrow from downstairs, free internet, and a direct line to phone home with (after buying a calling card). Pretty canal view from room 32, and a clean bathroom. Here`s what tipped this hotel over the edge: I booked into an apartment for 5 days after staying at this hotel for 2, because the apt had a kitchen. Let me tell you, I wished I`d stayed at Hotel Eureka. It feels so warm, friendly, inviting. Will with his classical music at night, have a cup of tea in the warm sitting room. I lost the keys to my apartment on the 2nd day and was able to come to this hotel and they helped me (gave us free tea and allowed the apt owner to phone me there when they got home). On my last night I went again and was given tea and a place to be quiet. If you dont need a kitchen, then I cant imagine why you`d stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. Unless you`re after 5 star accommodation. But at 110â‚¬-night, the price was right. If I go ack to Amsterdam I will only stay here. PS if you read the other reviews you`ll see that everyone loves this hotel!! :=)

Reviews.Title: “By Dutch standards......”
Reviews.Author: majrosebud
Reviews.Content: The good: I loved the people running the place. The location couldn't be better. Breakfast was awesome. Laid back atmosphere. Cool vintage guitar place next door. (The guy running the guitar shop is kind of a grump. Neat guy though.) My son, (19 yo), and I, (55 yo), had a blast in Amsterdam and part of the reason was this place... We checked in at the front desk and was warmly greeted. Got the key, walked up a treacherous stairway ( there was an elevator however), and opened the door to the "room". Oh my. Stained bedspread, old red shag carpeting, extremely small, no view whatsoever, old plumbing fixtures, kind of smelly. Went back down to the desk to change rooms and she said no can do. Unfortunately, we had prepaid. ...Oh well.... Maybe I've lowered my standards. Did the coffeshops put something in the tobacco to forever ruin what's left of my brain? Would I suggest this place? Hmmm... I think I would. Yeah really. Maybe not with my wife. If I was very concerned, I high ly suggest getting a canal side room. Then the wife would be happy. They are fine, in fact, really fine. Otherwise, lower your standards, smile at the front desk clerk, enjoy a great breakfast, and make the most of it!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute upgrade”
Reviews.Author: AlbertoS
Reviews.Content: My friend had been in this hotel years ago and he was very happy so he booked again it for this year. Unfortunately when we got at the reception to get our room a polite woman happily announces us that we have an upgrade, that's a self-catering apartment with canal view. It looks fine until we experienced the most noisy apartment ever. Someone had a party on the first night and we also received a telephone call at midnight! Basically we could hear people walking and talking as they were in our flat. We complained with the reception but nothing has changed and it was very disappointing not to have the room we asked in the hotel instead of a very noisy self-catering apartment. As a result I did not sleep for 3 nights in a row and ruined my stay in Amsterdam from this point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Emilene
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the more expensive, canal-facing double rooms for our stay to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I thought the room was wonderful, full of character, and the view was great. The staff were perfectly helpful and friendly and the breakfast room is lovely - although I thought the breakfast was a little overpriced for what you got. It's just a short walk or tram ride to all the places you might want to visit in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Most Friendly Hotel in the City!”
Reviews.Author: SBBreakfastClub
Reviews.Content: What a find this lovely little hotel was! The best part of the deal was the staff - gracious and helpfull at all times of the day. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the tea and coffee in the evening was an added bonus. The room, though slightly small for three, was sufficient as we spent little time there and had the dining room for additional space. Everything was clean and our request for extra towels was quickly filled. The free Wi-Fi was useful to give us directions to museums and tourist sites. Easy walking distance to everything we wanted to see in Amsterdam. Great little cafes right around the corner and across the canal. There are lots of littel hotels in Amsterdam, but what made this special was the staff. All truly liked working there and seemed to find satisfaction in providing excellent service. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: pocketsmc2
Reviews.Content: On our arrival at the hotel we were treated in a very friendly manner, given a load of sight seeing maps and brochures, and a general rundown of where all the sights and shopping centres were, which we found to be most helpful. The hotel itself although small was clean and served a lovely breakfast (buffet), it also had on line facilities and library with daily newspapers. A few minutes walk took us to rembrandt plein where a large choice of restaurants were to be found, also the shops on rokin and kalverstraat are nearby, making the hotel very central but not noisey. We had a great 5 days in Amsterdam made more enjoyable by the hotel staff who went out their way to make our stay as carefree and pleasant as possible. A big thankyou to all at the hotel for giving us a fine experience of Holland and Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great vibe”
Reviews.Author: cavernicola
Reviews.Content: Arriving there for not being happy with another hotel booked was marvelous!! This hotel next to the channel has everything you may need for a charming, cozy and good quality stay in Amsterdam. The rooms are quiet and confortable, the facilities cozy, the breakfast very good and the staff goes the extra mile to make you feel very good on your stay. Friendliness and good vibes is what we got there. Will come back and fully recommend for sure!! Rafael

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely WELCOME”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_Harris
Reviews.Content: We dropped into the Eureka on a busy Saturday afternoon, after being disappointed in a hotel in Zwanenberg. The lady at reception was so warm and friendly and although they didn't have a room available for Saturday night, we booked for Sunday night. On arrival at the Eureka we were met by Will who was again very welcoming and shown to a lovely room on the 2nd floor overlooking the canal. We had every comfort in the room and a great night's sleep in a large comfy double bed. Breakfast was free as it was our first (and unfortunately last) night of the stay, and was a delightful buffet of cheese, breads, meat, fruit, yoghurt and other sweet delights. I've haven't felt so relaxed in years and will definitely be booking with Amsterdam House Hotel Eureka for our next visit. In my view they saved my weekend away from being a complete disaster. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: daytona13
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Amsterdam House after a transatlantic cruise.It was our first time in Amsterdam, the location couldnâ€™t be beat and it was very quiet.There is a world class chocolate shop(Puccini) and a deli(sterk staaltje de eetw) around the corner on staalstraat. MacBike for bike rentals is a short walk away at Waterlooplein also. We spent a night in the hotel room and then was in an apartment. The apartment was on the 3rd floor and had a great view of the river. I didnt think accommodations would be so large in Amsterdam. This apartment had all the kitchen utensils needed. There was a corkscrew, refridge,microwave, coffee maker and even coffee/cream etc. The water for shower/sink was very hot, almost too hot at the highest setting. We didnâ€™t watch too much television but there were plenty of channels. All in all it was a great stay. The staff was accommodating, location was awesome and the weather was good. I would like to try a houseboat but the hotel/apartment were so nice we wont bother with it when ever we return.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect!!!"”
Reviews.Author: maryfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eureka Hotel from 12th April to 16th April 2008. Was early checking in but could leave bags while we wandered about the city until our room was ready. Checkin was quick and efficient. Stayed in room 42 on top floor,lovely view of canal. Room was clean and comfortable, bathroom was fine.Plenty of hot water whenever we needed it. Bed was very comfortable, and rooms were cleaned daily. Found the staff to be very polite and helpful. Loved the breakfast, incredible value for â‚¬10 per person, although first mornings breakfast is free!! Hotel is very centrally located but far enough from Rembrandtplein that you're not disturbed by noise in the night time.Would definately stay there again and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinions”
Reviews.Author: Andrew030
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about this place. I should first of all say that I stayed in the hotel (as I have several times before) and have never stayed in the apartments which, unlike the hotel, seem to get consistently bad reviews. It is conveniently located between the Museum areas and the central station. Probably about a 10 or 15 minute walk, if you take the most direct route, between the two. The hotel is on a nice quiet little street and the front of the hotel is attractive. Inside, the reception area is a little cramped. There is a lift. The rooms themselves (I have stayed in three of them) are very, very small - even by Amsterdam's standards - and beyond the reception there is something rather unkempt and fading about the whole establishment. On the top floor, there is a leak from the roof for instance. The walls are thin, but the rooms and the hotel pretty comfortable. Unlike other reviewers, my experience of the staff at this hotel is that they are consistently friendly and helpful: the male owner particularly so. The breakfast room is incredibly, incredibly charming. The food is good; there are large windows looking out from a rustic room, with (in summer) ducks waddling over the footpath out front. I have rated this "neutral/average" because I think the rooms and the structure of the building let down what would otherwise be a very nice little hotel. There are grander, cheaper options in town - few I suspect as well located - and it wouldn't be described as luxury accommodation. But it is certainly not budget either, and it is for this reason I think the upper floors of the hotel and its rooms are a bit of a let down on an otherwise very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you like dirty accomodations”
Reviews.Author: worldrip
Reviews.Content: I am sick of this place. 3rd stay and it has only gotten worse. I can't believe so many of these reviews say nice things. The office staff is deceptive, lies about the prices whenever it seems to suite them and nosy about what you are doing. The service - if you could call it that - is horrible. I just returned 3 days ago and am already planning my next trip. Amsterdam House will not be where I stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hazeleeno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Eureka for 4 nights and greatly enjoyed our trip. The Hotel was clean and functional, if a bit cramped, though that's the norm for Amsterdam. The staff were friendly and we were given free breakfast on our first morning. The breakfast is a large buffet and, like many others, I loved making my own eggs on the hot plate! We were allocated a 4th floor room, which had a canal view, although we hadn't paid the extra for that. The location is excellent - central without being noisy or sleazy. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bargain break!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: SteveWWallasey_UK
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Eureka Hotel once which was fine however they also rent Houseboats and Apartments which are amazing! Walking around Amsterdam really takes it out of you and putting your feet up in a houseboat on a canal right in the middle of town is the best possible antidote to tired legs. While the less informed rest, bored in their small windowless hotel you can be watching (and in most cases waving to) other boats that pass up and down the canals, smoking some of Amsterdam's finest and relaxing. We love this place and over the years have stayed in two different apartments and five different houseboats (all only a five minute walk to everything you need) as well as the hotel which have all been good. I would suggest the brown colored boat (with the red door) opposite the hotel is the best, but all the boats are amazing and are centrally heated which is important in Amsterdam in the winter. People expecting 5 star luxury should be warned there's a few dusty corners and all the cutlery wont match but if you can get over that you'll have the time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel---Loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mmkitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Eureka in April. We walked from central station which took about 20minutes(Please don't worry, tram available nearby). The hotel is on the canal, the receptionist was kind to offer the canal view room on our arrivla with extra fee which we declined. The room was very small as well as the bathroom, just space for sleep. Bed was very soft and my back didn't like that. We enjoyed the breakfast even with extra 10euro each. There were many selections of cereal, bread, yoghurt, fruit, smoked salmon( I think), cheese, eggs and some sweet. There was small corner we can make fried egg or omelette with some vegetable or ham. There was 2-3 soft drinks and tea/coffee was served by receptionist. The breakfast room is small but cosy, with fresh air from the canal in front. The location is fairly good, the canal tour is just across the bridge, the tram station is just 2-3 blocks away, the red light district was just 5minutes walk. Restaurant and cafe neaby but better walk little for more food selection. We recommend to rent a bike for sightseeing in Amsterdam---Very convenient with reasonable price, we returned bike earlier because we saw most things in less hours than we expected. Overall this Hotel is a budget Hotel without major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location... That Doesn't Match The Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Quasibonko
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in August & while it wasn't truly horrible, it was far less than ideal. If you are used to nice places (4-5 star) you'll want to avoid this one... and I mean, RUN. If you are however OK with lower class establishments & are only looking for a place to lay your head at night, you might have an excellent experience. From the outside, it delivers as it has a lovely facade (the pics do it justice) & is located on a lovely semi-quiet, low-traffic street. Inside however, I was not thrilled with the bare asthetics & shaggy magenta carpet, which also covered the typically winding and narrow Dutch staircase. The do have a lift however, which was a plus. I was put into room 25 which is in the back of the hotel & faces into the center of the building, so all you see is a small patch of sky up above, a sky light & tarred roof below, & windows of your neighbours all around. Many of whom talked loudly & smoked a lot well into the wee hours of the morning... This chatter plus the CONSTANT hallway traffic & ghastly-loud door-slamming made my sleep light. Forget about trying to have a lie in unless you brought earplugs & maybe a sleeping pill or 3. The room itself was dark, even despite a seemingly endless array of light fixtures to choose from. The wardrobe was spindly, the decor random & frankly kind of spooky, & the TV didn't work (only for DVD). The bed was low to the ground, lumpy, & took up a lot of the room space. I must say that it was pretty comfortable for the most part though. The bathroom was functional & I thanked God that there was plenty of hot water. The shower is annoying however because you end up getting a wet floor despite the grade in the tile, as there is no shower curtain, only the half sheath of glass to deflect the water. There was also quite a bit of grunge going on in the tile :0 Another thing I didn't like is that the reception desk only opens at eight, so when I went to check out at seven I had to walk a block to get a car to Schipol instead of having one called for me. I know, that's kind of whiny, but it was early & it just would have been nice to have some assistance. On the plus side, the staff are nice, and they have an ADORABLE little house dog. The cleaning staff were also really efficient & I always had fresh linens & towels (& Nescafe ;) ). Again, the location is unreal-good, and is right next to a lot of good Cafes & the Waterloo Plein market, etc., & just about everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book Standard Room”
Reviews.Author: jayeffell
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights in this hotel. My only real gripe was that (possibly own fault) was the standard double room that we booked was the worst we have had on any of previous four visits to The Dam. Asked for better quality room but would have had to pay a further 40 Euro per night...besides hotel was full. Had booked this as part of a 50th gift for fiancee and there was no real space in the room. We had paid roughly same price 2 year ago for bed/breakfast at nearby Hotel Nes and had great view over canal. ROOM in Eureka consisted of very large double bed which took up most of room, thin wardrobe (no drawers anywhere), TV, dvd player, hair dryer, tea making facilities...our room was at back of hotel facing other back rooms, pipes. SHOWER room was small but expected that but hated shower as it was of the type where curtain goes to floor and drains as floor on a slope...this did work ok but would have prefererred something to stand in. STAFF were very helpful and did explain this was their lowest standard of room and could not fault them as during our stay they were most helpful. As been to The Dam before we found this an ideal situated hotel. In the hotel we thought the stairs and walls, decoration in our room was quite tatty. Breakfast was excellent and free on first morning, 10 Euro the rest. I thought an idea would be good to offer the complimentary breakfast on the last day, especially for those who spend that bit too much and a good breakfast before flight home would be excellent. Overall, you get what you pay for in most hotels, if you get a great room by paying the standard price good on you. We did have this booked since November last year and had e-mailed our requests but got no response. We were on top floor room 45.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: courtnee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel at least 5 times a yr all over the world and I have to say this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. We were given room 15 on the back of the hotel it was very small, there was a small window which looked out onto a brick wall, it was very old fashioned with red shag pile carpet which looked like it had been down for years, stains on the walls,and the bed and linen were DAMP. The bathroom was a disgrace with mould all over the tiles and NO COLD RUNNING WATER., We tried to change the room but there was only one room available for an extra 40 euro's which we were happy to pay but the room they were offering was even smaller with two single beds which lay head to head along one wall. They wouldn't give us a refund so we could stay elsewhere so we were stuck with the room. We didn't stay for breakfast we couldn't wait to get out. Although the location was good I still strongly advise you not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, Great Value...”
Reviews.Author: Humax
Reviews.Content: We met the owner of this hotel on arrival - very friendly! We had a great room, with a view of the canal. It was a baking hot room, but nothing opening the window couldn't cure. Most importantly, the bed was big and comfortable and the shower powerful - for the money I can live without a massive ensuite. Importantly too, the hotel had a lift. Occassionally you could hear guests in the corridor, but it was not intrusive. The hotel is relatively central - only a short walk from rembrantsplein and the metro. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaSuperstar
Reviews.Content: Haven't long come back from the Dam and still suffering as I over indulged myself, nothing new there. Stayed for 3 nights in the corner appartment by the eureka hotel, fabulous position and the appartment was very nice, if you go there meet Will at the hotel, he extremely pleasant and helpful, received a personal e-mail from Will when I got home which really made my holiday, it's really nice when someone goes that extra mile !!! Will definately be going back there and booking with Amsterdam House and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Apartment”
Reviews.Author: tblant99
Reviews.Content: The apartment was perfect; lots of room, great view and nice decor. The staff were very helpful and made our stay all the more pleasant. Definately would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Canal boat was great!”
Reviews.Author: DC2florida
Reviews.Content: We rented a canal boat through the Amsterdam House Hotel Eureka for two nights. The view was wonderful--water on three sides! The location was excellent and easy to access. Even though a heavy snow was falling, with heavy winds as well, the boat did not rock very much at all and we stayed warm with the heating. The boat fit all 5 adults and two little ones comfortably. The little kitchen was fully stocked with pans, cutlery, cups and such. I would highly recommend this, and would stay there again. Only downside would be that the boat (eg, the floor) could have been a bit cleaner, but overall everything else was pretty clean. The price was great and the experience was absolutely unique!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Flat for 8 persons rented”
Reviews.Author: rolfitaly
Reviews.Content: We rented a well-equipped flat in the center of Amsterdam through this hotel. Initially there were some problems with the booking because they first confirmed another accomodation which later was not available. However, in the end they turned out to be fair on costs.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: pauliej
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in November 2006 and found this hotel to be ideal.It is a ten minute walk from the central station and just out of the way of the centre but close enough on foot ( 5 mins tom Dam square,ten minutes to the red light district) The rooms were small and basic but very clean and with its own toilet/shower suite. The staff (Will especially) were really helpful and friendly and could not do enough to make our stay as good as they could. The breakfast was ample and it was great to be able to cook our own omelettes on the hotplate!!! Overall i would highly recommend this place as we had a disastrous night the night before at the Hotel Hortus (do not stay there at all it is awful!) and this was an absolute pleasure to stay in after that.We would most certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: kdsud
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Amsterdam, and we chose the Hotel Eureka based on generally favourable Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disapointed. Arriving mid-morning following an early start from home we were treated to a comlimentary coffee and slice of apple pie in the lounge (these personal touches mean a lot and this was typical of our stay). We had asked for a double room but there was only a twin available and although the receptionist offered to change us the following day we decided to keep it for our 3 night stay. The room was "unusual" being long and narrow with the single beds end to end rather than side by side. The decor was also a bit "tired" and the furniture is best described as inexpensive antique. However, it was clean with enough space, had lots of character and a lovely view over the Amstel River. We also had fresh flowers on the coffee table the day after our arrival. Although Breakfast was not included in the price, the first mornings was complimentary and was good enough for us to pay 10 Euros each for the following days. The hotel lounge/breakfast room had a cosy feel to it and we enjoyed a relaxing complimentary drink there each evening before retiring. The location is great for exploring the centre of Amsterdam. In the heart of the Old Town but not near the Red Light District. The nearest tram stop was only a few minutes walk away so access to and from the station was no problem. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful, particularly after my wife was struck by a cyclist. (Be careful, they don't stop for red lights; no entry signs or pedestrians.) Her injuries were minor but a first aid kit and a large complimentary whiskey (for me) were promptly provided. Our stay in the hotel was well worth the price we paid although we could have saved a bit by booking our room there direct. Which is what we will do the next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Homesick”
Reviews.Author: placitas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to travel. We have visited many marvelous locations around the world. Nine years ago we drove from Berlin to Amsterdam and were looking for accomodations during Easter week. We hadn't made any reservations as we were traveling spontaneously. It was almost unfortunate as most hotels were booked, but then we happened upon Amsterdam House. Our lives were changed forever. The peope at Amsterdam House were so friendly and helpful. Although they too were fully booked they said they could accomodate us with an apartment. Since then we have visited Amsterdam on an almost yearly basis. We have stayed at many of Amsterdam House beautiful apartments and throughly enjoy each stay. I am homesick for Amsterdam House and our beautiful friends. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at this great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: p-itravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this great little hotel for 2 nights, mid July 2006. We wish that we could have stayed longer.... so we are already planning to return as soon as we can ! We totally agree with the positive sentiments expressed by previous guests via this site. The staff were certainly very friendly and helpful. The shower room was clean, the bedroom was clean and comfortable with great views over the Amstel canal. Being able to enjoy the substantial, buffet-style breakfasts up until noon was a bonus. Because of the very hot weather, we slept with the windows open. There was some noise from the local bars late at night, but no more than you would expect for a hotel located in the centre of a major European city. Roll on our return visit ! We can't wait !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: alerik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eureka for three nights during a very hot stretch of weather in July. This was probably not the best time to stay here, particularly on the fourth floor. Needing to keep the windows open led to a lot of noise from the typical Amsterdam nightlife below. However, this hotel did give us an exceelnt base from which to explore Amsterdam as there are many dining, drinking, and tourist options within 5 minutes and many more within 10 to 15 minutes. The room on the far end of floor four was average. The floor tilted across the room, making for an uncomfartable night on the like-tilted bed. Even by European standards, it was a pretty small room ... the door hit the side of the bed as we entered! Its not a bad hotel and the location is guaranteed to please. We found the staff to be helpful and the lift helps tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: AudreyO
Reviews.Content: June is high season in Amsterdam and we were lucky to get a room, so I was happy with this choice. Run by 4 people, who you see at different times doing different things, the house is like a converted home. The rooms are small but personally decorated with wonderful views on the canal. A quiet spot, near the theatre, the breakfast cum living room is decorated in plush red colours, with a bar and a copious breakfast! You can even make your own omlettes! The service was so friendly, you could not compare it with hotel chains... Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to alot, but there's better around”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJeny
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, small bathroom (only a shower), the rooms look out into a canal (nice view), but there are a couple bars across the canal that are extremely loud all night long. You have to keep the windows open since there is no A/C. Overall the place has a smell of cat pee, luckily, inside our room was not affected. The staff is absolutely no help and not very friendly. We asked for information on when the trams run and we were told to walk to the tram station and read the map. We let the woman know we didn't speak or read dutch and she just shrugged her shoulders and said she didn't live in the city. We wanted to reserve a taxi the night before we were leaving and the woman at the front desk said she can't do it, we have to call in the morning when we are ready. I got the # for the taxi and called the night before and they nicely took our reservation. I guess the front desk woman just didn't want to do it for us. Personally, there's so many places in Amsterdam to stay, I wouldn't waste my time here.

Reviews.Title: “gezellige (dutch for cosy) eureka hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the dutch have a word for it - 'gezellige',meaning charm,cosiness,friendliness and a place that puts you at ease right away. we stayed at the amsterdam hotel eureka for a week,14-21 june.i have stayed in stiffer,more formal and more expensive hotels,but nowhere with more real charm and easy friendliness. the room we had was no.22,with two huge windows and a handy pair of armchairs,were you can chill and watch the boats on the canal,the moorhens,the swans,and every morning,a grey heron which posed like a supermodel on the roof of the houseboat in front of us.there's also a massive and extremely comfortable bed and clean wc and showerroom ensuite,and lovely crisp cotton sheets each day. the area around the hotel is great- there are very comfortable,relaxed bars and cafes about 3 mins walk round the corner,it takes 12 mins to newmarket square and the zeedijk,5 mins to rembrandt's house,5 to rembrandt square (great for people-watching)5 to the flower market,15 mins walk to the rijksmuseum and the van gogh (but tram stops are only 2 mins away also).yet although the hotel is close to so much life,it is an oasis of calm and serenity. the house cat is a honey,and the staff here are just lovely. breakfast was magnificent - i had smoked salmon every morning! and you can eat as much as you like of a great array of salmon,ham,cheese (good cheese)yoghurt,juices,fruit and coffees,herb teas and tea. anyone who likes to feel their stay in their hotel is an effortless,informal and relaxed experience will love the hotel eureka- i did.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible houseboats and apartments”
Reviews.Author: jhd10003
Reviews.Content: Having stayed on Amsterdam Houses houseboats and in their apartments I can only say WOW! The best location in Amsterdam!!!!! Incredibly glamourous staff!!!! Do yourself a favour if you want to stay in the most incredible city on the planet---make your reservations now for accomodations that are out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “charming and laid back but won't suit petphobes”
Reviews.Author: lindsaymcat
Reviews.Content: went there for 5 nights, 4 of us. we got thereabout 12, we thought too early to check in, but one room was ready and we were welcome to leave our bags there. we were givben a 'welcome' drink by the manager. the rooms were small but charming - they go in a lot for wall-mirrors in this place! would not suit the very large/americans as there was just a bed, wardrobe, a stool, chair and table and absolutely no room for anything else! we booked late, so had a view of a sort of courtyard only, recommend book early for canal views, or houseboats. the bathrooms were also small, a shower, toilet and basin, but with a hairdryer and shower gel/shampoo, soap, cap, polish etc. easy use taps round pin plugs, but converters and apparently everything you can think of available at reception. tea and coffee making facilities you can smoke in the rooms but they do request you leave the window a little open. I didnt get the impression that they particularly wanted the other sort of smoking, but were like everyone else we met, very toleran. the beds are comfortable though a bit bouncy and the pillows springy. clean and comfortable, a little shabby here and there but nothing to worry most people. we had a dvd player with our television, and there is a supplyof dvds downstairs. clean towels and blissfully quiet. apart from the occasional door slamming or occasional burst of television from another room it was quiet, comfortable and the temperature was pleasant, though we were right in the centre of Amsterdam. breakfast is a very laidback 8.30am -12! - but then nowhere much seems to open very early in Amsterdam. good coffee or tea will be offered to you but otherwise you help yourself - cereals, fresh fruit salad,boiled eggs, toast, rolls, croissants cake cheese, ham, and you can fry or scramble your own eggs how you like them. its 10 Euros, but you can fill up, and refill and no hurry. there are plenty of cafes around, if you prefer, but you wont get a better one for less. stroll outside for a cigarette or just sit at one of the tables on the tiny pavement overlooking the canal, and you may well be stalked by a heron that visits every day for cheese, strolling up to the doors. or find a delightful cat sitting at one of the tables, or the friendly visiting dog sleeping in the doorway. its that kind of place. if the thought fills you with horror, go to some sanitised american hotel chain where everything looks exactly the same, and you cannot tell what city you are in. the eating room has a library of assorted books, some DVDs and there is free internet access on a Mac . guests strolled in and out, and chatted with the friendly people who run the place and each other, greeted the cat and dog as old friends and stepped in and out through the glass doors. the breakfast room turns into a dining room later, and a bit of a bar till about 11, though we brought down our own wine and carried on for another half hour or so after - kind of relaxed place. onto the little cobbled road which passes it on the canal-side, where we found a moorhen nesting on a boat, and 13 ducklings nesting on a tyre, also a resident tramp who lives on an old boat, and a tiny old closed gay club next door to the hotel where there was a squat party the night before we left, and they invited us in. again, didnt get kept awake at all after we gave up and went back into the hotel everyone was friendly, helpful and very tolerant of us raiding teabags, disappearing with ashtrays and borrowing glasses to take over to the party in the gay bar. acroos the bridge is Rembrandsplein, and 5 minutes walk away is the Waterlooplein and the fantastic fleamarket there, there is an internet cafe round the corner, fantastic fruit/chocolates/bread/dvd/books etc shops round the corner on Staalstraat, a few minutes from the flowermarket and trams in all directions, just at the edge of the red light district and the 'brown cafes' but much quieter. you get a room key and an outside key to get you in after midnight,and thankkfully on seeing the stairs theres a small and old but working lift. there is a safe in the wardrobe and spare bedding, shelves and hanging space adequate we found for 2 for 5 nights. so - very glad we went with the other reviews, yes its not entirely perfect - they forgot to renew the toilet paper once, but we just asked. woo - um cant think of anything else and I suppose some people would not want a cat padding round them at breakfast, or a tramp sleeping across the road, but if you want a bit of friendly, lived in style, but with comfort, then this will be one of those places to go back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint ,value for money,bolt hole”
Reviews.Author: planet-urko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel delightfully situated as it is 5 mins walk to the red light district , restaurant sector and nightlife but far enough away to avoid being constantly woken by revellers till the early hours. It is 15 mins walk from the train station with bags. Our room had a beautiful canal view and two large low level windows making it light and airy. It was clean quiet and comfortable. My only small criticism would be the shabby mismatched furniture most of which was damaged and had seen better days, there were broken tiles in the en suite shower which worked well but was a bit grubby. The room was not made up every day even though we were out by 9.30 am each morning. That aside our stay was very enjoyable . Service at breakfast and from the small bar was excellent and the reception staff were warm and friendly. For the price you cannot fault this hotel ,those used to 4/5 star accom. may find it rather basic but we found it excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Hotel Eureka”
Reviews.Author: geeked
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eureka was perfect for our stay in Amsterdam in every way. The location, friendly staff, and comfortable accommodations exceded my expectations. The hotel is located in the heart of the city along the Amstel, and being an old canal house, staying there was an experience in itself. Almost every major tourist attraction along with numerous restaurants and shops were within easy walking distance. For those that were not, we simply walked a block to the Muntplein station and caught the tram. Being so close to everything really helped cut expenses and made it convenient to stop by the hotel throughout the day to drop off bags or grab something from the room. The staff was extremely warm and friendly, including Moreno the cat who roams freely throughout the hotel. We were offered coffee and pie in the reception area upon checkin, and were also given plenty of tourist materials, maps, and information pamplets. On several occasions, the receptionists helped us with directions and made personal recommendations of things to do and see while in the city. The room was beautifuly decorated and most importantly clean. House keeping was convenient and thorough. No early morning knock at the door! The view of the city and canal just outside our window was breathtaking. The breakfast offered each morning is definately a must. Offering a wide array of food choices, it was both convenient and delicious. I reccommend this hotel full heartedly to anyone seeking an authentic and comfortable stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “charm and character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i are just back from hotel eureka and had a wonderfull time. we have been coming to amsterdam for a number of years now and have stayed at a number of hotels, some good, some bad and some downright ugly. i thought our stay at hotel eureka was our best yet. don't get me wrong, there are more "upmarket" hotels around, but many of those are the same no matter where you go, and after all amdsterdam isn't about glitz but old world charm. Hotel Eureka has that in abundance. the rooms have a fantastic view across the amstel, with upper floors having balconies. the windows open right out too which would be fantastic in summer. breakfast was good the two times we had it and all the staff where friendly. The location is perfect. turn right and you amble towards the red light district in about 2 minutes. dam square and the leidseplein are also within comfortable walking distance although there are trams if you are feeling lazy. i would also recommend perhaps turning left from the hotel once or twice which will lead you to a local market and the student district which has some nice cafes and shops we had never seen before. overall i really can't fault the hotel. the only thing i would add is that there is a dog and a cat within the hotel so to watch out for any allergies

Reviews.Title: “An EXCELLENT choice, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sometimes everything falls together: a great location in a very nice area with a lot of restaurants and pubs, a cosy room with a beautiful view and an extreme friendly and helpful staff. I am sure my wife and I will come back in Hotel Eureka!! Jozef and Isabelle

Reviews.Title: “A stay in heaven!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my husband and I had a stay in heaven!! in the charming Hotel Eureka. We had a very cosy room on the 4th floor with a breathtaking view over the pictoresque river Amstel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpfull and made our stay unforgettable.
